remarks.para: One or two brakes may be deactivated by capping the brake line provided:

numlitem.para: Takeoff and landing performance complies with AOM/AA Data, both for Gear Down dispatch and for two brakes deactivated, and
After takeoff, gear remains down for two minutes before retraction.
Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.
Stopping distances will increase.
Leave gear down for a minimum of 2 minutes after takeoff to permit affected wheel(s) to spin down prior to gear retraction.
Observe performance limitations.

note.para: At takeoff weights greater than 720,000 lbs., flaps up maneuver speed (V REF+ 100 kt) may exceed the landing gear retract speed (270 kt.). Therefore, ensure gear is retracted prior to selecting Flaps Up.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "WHEEL___ BRAKE(S) DEACTIVATED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: WHEEL BRAKES LINE DEACTIVATION
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: If Brake System Control Unit (BSCU) P/N S283U002-5 or later version is installed and one or two brakes are deactivated, advisory message ANTI-SKID for the affected wheels may be inhibited as follows: Rotate the BSCU (E9 Rack) message inhibit knobs on the unit’s front face so that one knob points to each affected wheel’s position number. Advisory level message ANTI-SKID will not display if an anti-skid fault is present. While en route, if an additional anti-skid fault occurs affecting another wheel, EICAS will again display ANTI-SKID.

numlitem.para: Examine the wheel brake(s) for leaks or damage.
If there is a leak and no damage, and the leak exceeds the limits defined in AMM 32-41-15, use DEACTIVATE BRAKE(S) Procedure in paragraph 3 below. If brake is damaged use MEL 32-41-1-3.
DEACTIVATE BRAKE(S:
Remove pressure from hydraulic systems 1, 2, and 4.
Release the parking brake.
Release pressure from the hydraulic brake accumulator by operating the brake pedals until the HYD BRAKE PRESS gauge on the P1 panel shows pre-charge pressure (approximately 750 psi).

Uncouple the Brake Quick Disconnect – Brake Hose Half and attach the hose to the landing gear truck using tie-wrap P/N BACS38K3D or P/N PLT2S-C3. This will ensure that the hose will not interfere with brake rotation when the gear is retracted.

note.para: The part of the Brake Quick Disconnect that is attached to the hose is called the Brake Quick Disconnect – Brake hose Half. The part of the Brake Quick Disconnect that is attached to the brake is called the Brake Quick Disconnect – Brake Half.
The Brake Quick Disconnect incorporates a pressure release function in the Brake Half; there is no need to open the brake bleed fitting for dispatch.

numlitem.para: Pressurize hydraulic system 1, 2 or 4.
Apply brake pressure and check for leaks.
If removed brake line disconnect is found to leak:
Depressurize system by following steps 3.A thru 3.C.
Remove, disconnect and cap line.
Perform steps 3.E. and 3.F.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
